node.title: Who Is Bipin Rawat? Helicopter Crashes With India's Top General Aboard
node.alt: Chief of Defence Staff Bipin Rawat delivers a speech during the launch ceremony for the stealth frigate Himgiri into the Hooghly River in Kolkata on December 14, 2020.
node.description: Defense chief General Bipin Rawat was aboard an Mi-17V5 helicopter that crashed near the town of Coonoor in southern India.
node.content:
["A military helicopter carrying India's top general has crashed in southern India.", "Defense chief General Bipin Rawat was aboard an Mi-17V5 helicopter that crashed near the town of Coonoor, in southern India, on Wednesday, the Indian Air Force said in a tweet.", "At least four people were killed, but officials told Reuters they were still checking to see if he was among the dead.", "\"An inquiry has been ordered to ascertain the cause of the accident,\" the Air Force said in a tweet.", "Rawat was travelling from an Indian Air Force base in Sulur to the Defence Services Staff College in Wellington in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu to deliver a lecture.", "Rawat was made India's first Chief of Defence Staff (CDS) by Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government in late 2019.", "He assumed the newly created post, aimed at integrating India's Army, navy and the air force, after retiring as the army's chief.", "This is a breaking story and this article will be updated.", "", "
Chief of Defence Staff Bipin Rawat delivers a speech during the launch ceremony for the stealth frigate Himgiri into the Hooghly River in Kolkata on December 14, 2020.
"]
